author: g11tech
content: guys do ELs properly support (i.e. actually implement rather than returning dummy false) this flag: `shouldOverrideBuilder`? cc <@758579010027782144> <@543900561460822016>

author: g11tech
content: we at lodestar are wondering if this feature is "in play" for goerli deneb forks?

author: rjected
content: reth does not

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: geth does not either iirc

author: g11tech
content: ethereumjs also doesn't (and doesn't even plan to)

author: rjected
content: The flag is a nice idea but designing and implementing a good heuristic is the bulk of the work, and is not super high prio for us at least

author: g11tech
content: right and there are more targetted solutions like inclusion lists, but i am wondering if these flows every get triggered since some of the CL discussions regarding produceblock apis are themed around engine response being centric to choose builder block or not

author: marekm3498
content: For now - Nethermind does not

author: jgm
content: From my point of view, the validator client just takes whatever the beacon node gives us.  But having the flag in place and having the beacon node act on it, even if its currently a dummy in most/all implementations, is still a good place to be.

author: g11tech
content: my concern is it just not ends up like a dummy flag never implented so would be nice if someone does has the plan to implement it

author: g11tech
content: but as <@122421399213047814> said, it might involve heuristics which might require time to analyze censorship patterns

author: potuz
content: <@792822129019584562> Marius had some PoC for geth, I'm working on a PoC for ePBS on Prysm and if no one takes up this on geth I'll myself will open the PR to implement some heuristic

author: jgm
content: I believe that different beacon nodes already have different circuit breakers in place, so something similar from execution clients where they come up with their own ideas would likely produce a robust system.

author: potuz
content: there are some pretty simple and robust heuristics to prevent the worst possible of censorships, and since we will need them anyway for inclusion lists I'm sure they will be implemented for these endpoints anyway

author: potuz
content: Perhaps <@672060238475558934> is already working on this for geth

author: g11tech
content: can we have sort of a spec for these heuristics (like how we have in CL for gossip accept/reject) for the aim of shared knowlege and implementation

author: potuz
content: I do not want this to be specified

author: potuz
content: I want this to be explicitly not specified

author: potuz
content: But if you want just some design notes sure I can write a quick hackmd with at least the heuristics that I'd like to see implemented on some ELs. In Marius'  PR I added some quick notes

author: potuz
content: the simplest example of something I think it's the worst censorship is that ELs should refuse to use the builder' s block if they see the same transaction being reorged twice

author: g11tech
content: yea that solves the purpose
